quotes.quote: No kind of bomb ever built will extinguish hatred.
The atomic bomb is too dangerous to be loose in a lawless world.
You can bomb the world to pieces, but you can't bomb it into peace. Power to the peaceful.
The atom bomb was no 'great decision.' It was merely another powerful weapon in the arsenal of righteousness.
Making bombs will only destroy us. It doesn't matter whether we use them or not. They will destroy us either way.
The nuclear bomb is the most useless weapon ever invented. It can be employed to no rational purpose. It is not even an effective defense against itself.
Some people believe that the nuclear bomb should be awarded the Nobel Peace Prize, since it scared the major powers away from war by equating it with doomsday.
The atomic bomb made the prospect of future war unendurable. It has led us up those last few steps to the mountain pass; and beyond there is a different country.
Bombs know no ism but barbarism. The laws that successfully govern a peaceful and democratic society do not interfere with the only law bombs know, which is the law of gravity.
Bombs do not choose. They will hit everything.
Bombs are probably more merciful than bayonets.
Any time bombs are used to target civilians it is an act of terror.
The greatest danger of bombs is in the explosion of stupidity that they provoke.
Nuclear bombs have made mass murder a reality. Nuclear bombs threaten humankind.
Pretty much the worst reason to bomb someone is to prove that you're willing to bomb someone.
The atomic bomb embodies the results of a combination genius and patience as remarkable as any in the history of mankind.
A bomb makes more noise than a caress, but for each bomb that destroys, there are millions of caresses that nourish life.
A bomb is a bomb, what's the difference between different kinds of bombs? All bombs are to kill, but it's about how to use it.
The atomic bombs will surely shorten the war, and let us hope that they will effectively end war as a possibility in human affairs.
The issue isn't the accuracy of the bombs you have, it's how you use the bombs you have - and more importantly, whether you ought to use bombs at all.
The atomic bomb certainly is the most powerful of all weapons, but it is conclusively powerful and effective only in the hands of the nation which controls the sky.
The moral to be legitimately drawn from the supreme tragedy of the bomb is that it will not be destroyed by counter bombs even as violence cannot be by counter-violence.
The man who throws a bomb is an artist, because he prefers a great moment to everything.
The nuclear bomb took all the fun out of war.
The only use for an atomic bomb is to keep somebody else from using one.
Bombs take hours or days to reach every corner of the earth. Words arrive instantly and kill more people. They are a weapon of mass destruction.
There is such thing as a 'smart bomb' - bombs are smart these days, you know.
